185962722.review:
Les Sims 3 est l'un des meilleurs jeux de simulation de vie jamais créés. Bien qu'il ait été lancé en 2009, il reste un classique de la franchise Les Sims. Ce jeu offre une liberté et une profondeur de gameplay que de nombreux autres jeux de simulation n'ont pas réussi à égaler. Que vous soyez un vétéran de la série ou un nouveau venu, Les Sims 3 est un jeu incontournable pour ceux qui aiment la gestion de vie virtuelle et la créativité sans limites.

C'est un jeu inégalé en termes de liberté et de personnalisation dans la franchise Les Sims. Avec un monde ouvert, une énorme capacité de création et une profondeur de gameplay qui permet de raconter des histoires riches et variées, il reste l'un des meilleurs jeux de simulation jamais réalisés. Bien qu'il présente quelques problèmes de performance et des bugs occasionnels, ces aspects n’enlèvent rien à l’expérience immersive et divertissante qu'il offre. Si vous aimez les jeux où la créativité et l’interaction sont au cœur du gameplay, je recommande vivement Les Sims 3. Avec les nombreuses extensions disponibles, il y a toujours quelque chose de nouveau à découvrir, ce qui en fait un jeu auquel on peut jouer pendant des heures sans jamais se lasser.

185805768.review:
Ok I rarely do reviews,
I do not review Sims games there endles fun games..or well they used to be..
It is time to do one.

Let me start & say I am Disabled,
my mind is more a child I see's things different despite the adult age number, 
I am not great at grammer & I do not do short reviews,
I stink at properly getting my thoughts out with tiny reviews..
especially when a dev/company Like Electronic Arts has upset me ..

I may get a tad uppity (upset) in parts,
this game & EA have caused me so many headaches & upsets over the course of the series & years I have played I have finally had it...
Never wanted to do a review for Sims but if im gonna do one its gonna be the one I love the most.

The Sims 3.

Short end of stuff:
I do Not recommend The Sims 3 game especially if you have a Steam Deck on Linux default OS unless you have alot of patience, 
patience to mod, Patience to read tons of tutorials or just to deal with lag, 
crashes & error codes & eventually losing your legacy's to issues as that will happen with this game.
Its all a facade the first couple hours it runs stable but you will notice the lag in areas from  the start like Create a style or Create a sim.

I do not recommend Any Sims game in general as EA doesn't care about its players fully,
they only care to do everything they can to milk the name & make money,
then when the game isn't making enough monies they leave it broken & move on to a new Sims series Sims 2 was left with a Pink Soup texture issue that can  occor longer play sessions, Sims 3 with its lag, errors & crashing & eventually Sims 4 will meet the same fate.

I recommend looking into Paralives & Inzoi that are coming 2025.
both have a color wheel; Let you be creative they both look to change so much & both look to actually want to listen to there community!
Paralives in specific looks to change the Life Simulation game in general with free updates free DLC content..


Sims has been one of my attachment games sense my mom got me into Sims 1,
being disabled I cant do alot, so I like Life Simulation games where I can experience stuff live out things I cant ever do in real life..

I mainly Played Sims 2 the most.
Moved to Sims 3 for a few years when I got a laptop & one of my humans gave me the near complete disc collection missing some SP packs,..
I used mods to make it stable, being windows it was easier to situate.

I moved to Steam Sims 3 when I got my Steam Deck & Getting Mods to work on Linux Steam Deck is not easy at all.
Sims 3 in general without performance mods is laggy, crashy & error happy..

but The Sims 3 was the last good Sims we have that is indepth, not lazy & just made right,
yes it started to get greedy..it was a sign of things going downhill for the series but it held its ground for the most part.

I have less packs then I did before on Windows, I am running Steam digital Sims 3, Ambitions, Pets, Seasons & Generations.
I have tried to play with no mods no store stuff..see no difference honestly.

while its smooth in game play for a bit its terrible lag/freezes in Create a style (color wheel tool) can push one away fast..

if you dont use Sims 3 create a style tool your looking at less issues for a bit, depending on how many packs u are loading.
over time as u play the main game will start to lag, fill up with bloat & crash.
eventually getting error 12 code & sometimes not loading in,

Sims 3 is still using 32 bit code  meaning it cant really utilize all of our pc's modern specs or ram it needs a 64 bit update,
on top of fixing things..seeing how the mac 64 version went it needs a remake or a proper fixing...

it can only use 4gb max atm & even then getting that to work on steam deck is a hassle as u can't just patch the EXE,
like you could on windows as Steam is using Linux with proton for window fixes..

You will need the Smooth Patch, 
4GB exe ram patch, 
will need to look into tutorials for fixing things, 
Nraas mods, 
house boat lag fix from mod the sims..
prob many others just to fix performance alone..

Though if you can put up with all the fixing all the issues it has:
Sims 3 is the best Sims we have atm.

its more indepth with its features.
Snow has depth its not flat paint you can actually lose your child in the snow lol,
Sims 3 has a color wheel so no buying hundreds of packs like in Sims 4 just to get a few new swatchs that work with only that packs items..
The color wheel works for nearly everything including hair & clothing, Making The Sims 3 the most creative sims to date.

there is more objects that can be used like phones, the Teleporting nonsense seen in Sims 4, is minimal if any in Sims 3.
cars that can be driven, bikes & jetskies to have & can be use.
with more expansions you can run hotels, can explore tombs, go to the future! like this game has so much in it.
You can even have houseboats to build & they can be driven..
there is open worlds no loading screen junk you got like a couple loading screens here & there but nothing as bad as Sims 4,
You have horses to ride around the open world..
tiny pets to collect, on top of gems, fish from fishing, crops to grow depending on your packs there is alot of gameplay to be had.
actions are carried out without major issues or delays,simulation lag is not a thing with Sims 3 but is with Sims 4..
just everything in Sims 3 is more detailed, packs actually feel worth there price tag.
Some occults are done better in Sims 3 over 4 like Mermaids.
Sims 3 I feel has way better traits.


Though there is So much good..Sims 3 has its bad..
Sims 3 your dealing with lag, crashes, error codes, bugs & issues.
Electronic Arts & The Sims game gave up on Sims 3 left it broken & still sell it for a high price.
cause EA has the habit of pushing there games till they break then just dropping support & moving to the Next Sims game...

while others state Sims 3 is playable on deck,
that is only if you have the patience,
the patience to wait as the create a style tool lags & then hard freezes at times,
the patience to start a whole new legacy when  error 12 occurs..
the patience to deal with game freezes & stuttering as you play long sessions..
the patience to deal with crashes that can happen at any point losing hours of play as it doesnt auto save properly without a mod.
the patience to get mods to work, to get the launcher to work on deck which is a whole hassle in itself.
you can't even install Sims 3 pack easily with Steam deck.
its a whole juggle to run this game ever sense moving from a windows laptop & Disc Sims 3 I have spent more time trying to fix the lag & issues with Sims 3 & my Steam Deck, Sims 3 needs Patience, Something I do not have.


I can't recommend Sims at all anymore, a series I once loved has sank to pure greed..

Honestly I feel if they do not fix up Sims 3 with the hinting January Nostalgia thing its over for me I will move on to Paralives & Inzoi, 
a fresh start & adventure that I hope allows me to finally have a proper life sim game where I can create a legacy,
finally do things I have wanted to do in Sims games but haven't been able to do cause of issue after issue or missing features..
sure those are Early Acess but I have more hope in them then I have now for Sims & Electronic Arts.

Go look into Paralives & Inzoi, they are gonna be similar to Sims & a prob much better as a plug & play experience without having to spend hours researching how to fix issues or what mod to download to add back X/Y feature..

Sims & Electronic Arts are gonna drown the Sims games with DLC & updates till they no longer run right,
Only fix so much, then when it stops being profitable they will drop it broken & all & move on to the Next Sims idea.

They Do not care they leave the Sims 3 up in its broken state to scam players & use that money to put towards Sims 4..

Noice



On a helpful note - 2 of the biggest bugs i have do have solutions 

game won't launch/ black screen when starting?
 Press play on steam once the launcher opens turn down the amount of cores it uses in task manager then press play on the launcher. (You can turn it back up after)

Sims aren't moving but effects are still going? (such has plum bob moving, steam from cooking ect)
  Sadly it's the save file and starting a fresh save fixes. Usually if the glitch happens it starts in the very beginning or doesn't happen at all so at least you won't have to start over mid game!

185401243.review:
Let’s face it—The Sims 3 may seem like a wholesome life simulation on the surface, but if you’ve ever played it, you know the truth: you are the antagonist. You’re not some benevolent god guiding your Sims toward happiness. No, you’re the puppet master of chaos, poking, prodding, and occasionally trapping your virtual subjects in a series of absurd, tragic, and downright cruel situations—all for your own amusement.

Here’s a guide to recognizing and fully embracing your villainous role in The Sims 3:

1. The Illusion of Free Will
Your Sims think they have autonomy, with their quirky traits, whims, and ambitions. But let’s be real—none of that matters. You override their desires at every turn. That Sim who dreams of being an astronaut? They’re now a kleptomaniac stylist. The one who craves true love? Sorry, they’re doomed to a loveless existence in a house with no doors. Their lives are not their own—they’re yours to toy with.

2. The Architect of Their Misery
The power of Build/Buy Mode makes you a godlike force in your Sims’ lives. You could create a cozy dream home—but where’s the fun in that? Instead, you design labyrinthine mansions with no bathrooms, pools with no ladders, and basements where Sims mysteriously disappear after a visit. Your creativity knows no bounds when it comes to their suffering.


3. Exploiting Their Weaknesses
Sims are programmed with predictable behaviors and flaws, and you exploit them at every opportunity. Did your Sim just autonomously walk outside during a thunderstorm? You laugh and let it happen. Did they inherit the "Clumsy" trait? Time to send them on a tightrope walk over a pit of fire (figuratively, of course—unless you have mods).


4. Turning Life Into a Soap Opera
Romance and family? Ha! You’re here to stir up drama. Your Sim doesn’t need a stable relationship—they need a love triangle, an affair with the maid, and a rival who just happens to "accidentally" burn their house down. Every family gathering becomes an opportunity for chaos, and every marriage is one poorly-timed flirtation away from implosion.


5. Immortal Torture
Sims fear death, but you don’t fear Grim. In fact, you summon him regularly, sometimes just to chat. But even death isn’t the end for your Sims—you can bring them back as ghosts, zombies, or mummies and continue the torment. Eternal rest? Not on your watch.


6. The Puppet Master of Generations
Your cruelty doesn’t end with one Sim—it spans generations. Legacy challenges are your playground of torment, where you saddle Sims with cursed traits, force them into careers they hate, and control every aspect of their lives for decades. You’re not just a tyrant; you’re an eternal tyrant.


7. Mods: Tools of Absolute Power
Mods take your villainy to new heights. With mods, you can inflict even more chaos: alien invasions, supernaturally convoluted love lives, or the ability to turn every Sim in town into a zombie apocalypse. If the base game isn’t cruel enough for you, mods let you truly ascend as the ultimate antagonist.

You might tell yourself you’re playing The Sims 3 to "guide" and "help" your Sims, but deep down, you know the truth. You are the villain of this story—a capricious, omnipotent force of chaos who exists to laugh at their struggles and marvel at their resilience. And that’s okay.

Because at the end of the day, the true joy of The Sims 3 isn’t creating a perfect life—it’s watching it all fall apart.

185324297.review:
[h1] APPROACH WITH CAUTION [/h1]

my god, this game is held by Spit and rubber bands. i'm not joking.
geting this thing to work was a headache. so if you're expecting an easy instalation of this, stay far away from this game. you have been warned.

if you're still here... then lemme give you the procedure:
you gotta discover your Videocard ID in the Graphics card log file in the documents file of your pc, and ADD to the graphics card file under the Bin folder of the game using notepad++ the second string (asuming it is from a big vendor like NVIDIA, AMD, or Intel, if not you gonna have to add both strings to your graphics cards file, Vendor, and the Card-ID-Card nade), so the game gets to detect your videocard. you also need to mess with the graphics rules file to up the VRAM available for the game so it runs within your modern machine spec. and even after that, you gonna need ALL (and i cannot stress enough, ALL) of NRASS mods, Smoth patch, Isla paradiso routing fix, houseboat helm fix, and a LOT more just to get this game up and running.

have i made the dreamlauncher to work? Yes. but only for a Minute, and the game .exe decided to not to work. so what was something to make life easier gave me more headaches. (and i don't blame the creator of that launcher here. it opens and works, but the game doesn't launch with it, given, again that the game is assembled with spit and rubber bands), so back to square one.

phew. okay. so after all that, is the game worth it?!
surprisingly, YES IT IS. the gameplay is super engaging. and i spent more hours than i should building homes, apartments, sims from various tv shows, and now am doing a ridiculous dificult challenge (turning all sims of Isla Paradiso into mermaids, no family change allowed, and only cheat allowed is the one to immediately buy the Mermadic Kelp/permanent mermaid upgrade once i get one of my descendents to marry a sim outside the household). there is a lot of fun to be held in this game.

it is just a shame that this game is so BADLY optimzed by EA and still is sold at this ridiculous price (BRL 75+375 for all expansions in 2025. the price of a new game.). don't get me wrong, the game is fantastic, and one of the last works of the original Maxis team we all know and love, but EA could and honestly SHOULD make this game playable out of the box if they gonna sell it. it is not that hard.

Game:10/10
Final Score:7/10

i [b]CANNOT [/b] for the life of me recommend this for anyone who just expects this to work perfectly out of the box. it will not, and CANNOT. if you got a "too modern" pc even (Alder Lake CPU, Aka Intel 12000 series or over, you still need to get another patch for it to work. thankfully my I7 8700 runs it without that. but it is the final shoryuken to the face we get from EA with this game). i am just recommending IF, and only IF, you got patience and know-how to make this game run and giving a thumbs up because this is the game we want, not the DLC simulator Sims 4 is. seriously, on SALE, that thing costs 3000 with all DLCs, and the game has a stroke with all the content installed.

urgh... MAN... i really, REALLY WISH, there was a competitor to EA. because dear god, what a nightmare i had to deal.

184771450.review:
[h1][b]The Sims 3[/b][/h1]
[u](Data da Análise: 03/01 (Janeiro) 2025)[/u]

[quote]Esta análise é um oferecimento de [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44935382][b]Brazil Games Review[/b][/url], siga para mais análises.[/quote]

 The Sims 3 é um jogo de simulação de vida lançado em 2009, desenvolvido pelo estúdio Redwood Shores da Maxis e publicado pela Electronic Arts (EA). Sendo a sequência de The Sims 2, o título é amplamente considerado por muitos como o melhor e possivelmente insuperável jogo da franquia... não fosse pelos problemas técnicos.

[h2][b]Gráficos/Arte[/b][/h2]

 Ao abordar a direção de arte em The Sims, é evidente que The Sims 4, sendo o título mais recente, apresenta a melhor qualidade gráfica. No entanto, os gráficos de The Sims 3 revelam um cuidado adicional que, embora sejam considerados inferiores, ainda preservam detalhes expressivos, mesmo que sutis. Um exemplo notável é a textura dos personagens, que evita a aparência de uma cera, permitindo que características como a marcação dos músculos sejam visivelmente destacadas, dando uma vivacidade maior.

[h2][b]Trilha Sonora[/b][/h2]

 De forma incontestável, The Sims 3 possui a melhor OST entre todos os títulos da franquia, sendo especialmente marcante para os nostálgicos. Sua trilha sonora é uma das mais emblemáticas e clássicas no universo dos jogos, deixando um impacto duradouro nos fãs que jogaram na infância.

[h2][b]Gameplay[/b][/h2]
 Quando experimentei The Sims 3 em meu Xbox 360, o jogo parecia bastante limitado, e eu acreditava que essa limitação permanecia até os dias atuais. No entanto, ao jogar a versão para PC, fiquei positivamente surpreso. A quantidade de conteúdo disponível proporciona a sensação de que é possível alcançar, sem dificuldade, 50 horas de jogo. Infelizmente, The Sims 3 marca o início de uma decadência em termos de atenção aos detalhes, ainda que a imersão se mantenha. Um exemplo disso é a ausência da animação de entrada nos veículos, substituída por uma simples transição instantânea, bem como a persistência do evento envolvendo ladrões — detalhes que foram completamente abandonados no jogo seguinte...

 Apesar dessas questões, The Sims 3 oferece a maior liberdade da franquia, destacando-se pelo mundo aberto. A transição entre casas ocorre sem as telas de loading, o que facilita e torna ainda mais prática a interação, como espiar seus vizinhos pela janela. Em alguns mapas, existem linhas de metrô que agilizam o deslocamento, embora haja uma chance de seu Sim ser furtado durante o trajeto (um bom detalhe).

 As expansões cumprem seus propósitos de forma exemplar, sendo indispensáveis para enriquecer ainda mais o jogo. Diferentemente de The Sims 4, The Sims 3 oferece conteúdo de qualidade em grande quantidade, tornando a experiência significativamente mais completa, apesar dos preços.

[h2][b]Fatores técnicos[/b][/h2]

 Além da prática preços abusivos que incentivam o consumo de The Sims 4, a desenvolvedora falhou de maneira grave na otimização do jogo, especialmente considerando que se trata de um título de 32bits e mundo aberto. Diversas correções pela comunidade foram criadas com o objetivo de melhorar o desempenho, com muitas delas restringindo as interações dos outros Sims não jogáveis, mas aplicando limitações que não comprometem totalmente a experiência geral. A vivacidade do jogo é tão bem apresentada, que chega a ponto de os Sims não controlados pelo jogador receberem praticamente a mesma atenção e complexidade de vida que os Sims próprios, o que, paradoxalmente, afeta negativamente o desempenho.

 Quando afirmo que a otimização é gravemente deficiente, não se trata de drama. O impacto varia de computador para computador, mas, em muitos casos, essas correções apenas tornam o jogo jogável, sem solucionar completamente os problemas de desempenho. O jogador acaba sendo obrigado a se acostumar com pequenos engasgos e quedas de FPS constantes, tornando a experiência frustrante para aqueles que esperam fluidez, mesmo possuindo um computador bom ou fraco.

[b]Maneiras de tentar arrumar seu jogo:[/b]

[b]Guia:[/b] https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1131162350
[b]Playlist de vídeos:[/b] https://youtu.be/JwwGyAbDGb0?si=UeImGXi5vEXBtbst

[h1][b]Custo-benefício[/b][/h1]

 É raro que o jogo entre em promoção, e, quando isso ocorre, seu preço costuma girar em torno de R$ 30, enquanto apenas as expansões ficam com descontos, geralmente pela metade do valor original. Embora já tenha sido vendido por R$ 8,97... isso foi em 2018 e o preço parece aumentar a cada ano. Não é a melhor ideia pagar R$ 79,90 por um jogo que está longe de oferecer o mínimo de estabilidade técnica, a menos que a pessoa seja o maior fã de The Sims.

184737105.review: Very wonderful game but you should own a musket for home defense, since that's what the founding fathers intended. Four ruffians break into my house. "What the devil?" As I grab my powdered wig and Kentucky rifle. Blow a golf ball sized hole through the first man, he's dead on the spot. Draw my pistol on the second man, miss him entirely because it's smooth bore and nails the neighbors dog. I have to resort to the cannon mounted at the top of the stairs loaded with grape shot, "Tally ho lads" the grape shot shreds two men in the blast, the sound and extra shrapnel set off car alarms. Fix bayonet and charge the last terrified rapscallion. He Bleeds out waiting on the police to arrive since triangular bayonet wounds are impossible to stitch up. Just as the founding fathers intended.

184615408.review:
After you go through all the mods that optimize your experience with The Sims 3, the game becomes truly enjoyable. I recently transitioned from The Sims 2 Ultimate Collection to this installment, and I must say, it’s been an incredible upgrade. I had also played 
The Sims 4, but it didn’t give me the same sense of satisfaction and fun that I’ve found in The Sims 3.  

One of the standout features of The Sims 3 is its open-world design, which allows you to seamlessly explore neighborhoods without loading screens. This adds a level of immersion that is absent in 
The Sims 4 and even The Sims 2. Whether you're sending your Sim to the park, the bookstore, or just letting them roam the streets, the freedom is exhilarating and makes the game world feel alive.  

Another advantage is the deep customization options. "The Create a Style" tool allows you to customize every piece of furniture, clothing, and even wallpaper with an endless variety of patterns and colors. This level of personalization makes it feel like your Sims' world is truly unique.  

The game also shines in its storytelling capabilities. With the introduction of "Story Progression", other families in your neighborhood evolve and change on their own, creating a dynamic and unpredictable environment. It adds a layer of realism and complexity to the gameplay that wasn’t present in earlier installments.  

However, it’s not a perfect experience right out of the box. The Sims 3 is infamous for its performance issues, such as lag and long loading times. This is where mods become essential. Mods like NRAAS Master Controller or Overwatch help streamline the game, reduce bugs, and improve performance significantly. Once optimized, the gameplay experience becomes smooth and highly enjoyable.  

Ultimately, what makes The Sims 3 stand out is its balance between freedom, creativity, and immersion. It feels like a living, breathing world where your Sims can truly thrive. If you’re willing to invest a bit of time in optimizing it, this game can easily become one of the best in the franchise.

The Sims 3 will forever hold a special place in my heart. I first discovered the game through Pets 360 console version, then PC, and the rest is history.

Used to play a lot of it back in 2011-2013 with just a few expansions, but it was enough to give me joy. As time went on, I kind of stopped playing. I did play The Sims 4, but it doesn't really spark joy the same way it did in 3.

Fast forward to now, the whole Sims 3 collection on Steam went on sale for a reasonable price. I decided to buy it, and am already getting sucked back into the game easily after so many years. Thank you for being an awesome part of my childhood, my favorite go-to comfort game.

184199498.review:
Forever the best Sims game, by farrrrr! The extra r's are necessary to portray the extent of how far. IT'S FAR. IT'S NOT CLOSE.

I used to play sprawled across the living room floor with my mom's laptop, for hours and hours, til that old thing burned against my lap. I would always buy the tiny trailer house, and set fire to it immediately trying to cook my Sim's first meal. I would trap my Sims in pools without ladders and watch in awe as they drowned. I would trap my pregnant Sims in rooms without doors just to see what would happen to them if they couldn't make it to the hospital to give birth. Uh...what? I mean...haha, ahah, that's sooo weird. Ahhh, the inquisitive minds of children. Needless to say, the way I play has changed a LOT in the 15-ish years since then, but this game is still just as fun as ever. I highly recommend buying it and all of its packs when they're on sale. Yes, all of them. Yes, even the Stuff packs. At sale price, they're beyond worth it. See you all in another 15-ish years, because this game and I are 4lifersssss

183656066.review:
[h1]Thanks EA... [/h1]

[b][i]What a surprise I woke up to when I saw the acclaimed ''best sims game'' having a crap ton of microtransactions...[/i][/b] 

[hr][/hr] 
Using mods to restore them is very difficult to get working right as some machines apparently won't register these MTX restoration mods due to conflicts in the mods folder. 

It wasn't enough to pay for the damn dlcs (which was 80 bucks at sale for me with everything, [b]almost $200 at full price[/b]) but you don't even get half the furnitures since a good chunk of it is microtransactions... 

[b][EDIT][/b]

With everything at full price it's actually closer to [h1]$400[/h1]

[hr][/hr] 
[i][b](Finding tutorials on YouTube on how to do this process is futile as most of the videos are really poorly made missing very important links and jumps around everywhere without getting to the point only for it to not work at all....)[/b] [/i]

[hr][/hr] 

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
[b]I'm just gonna say it out right but this game was made for female whales who just want to buy cute things for their houses. I see the appeal of this game and it can be very fun with mods and and some cool characters to make your own lore but even this old ass game from 2009 cannot be pure enough to [b]not[/b] be held at gunpoint with greedy practices.[/b]

[h3]Would I recommend this game? Only if you get it at 90% sale with everything included at a cheap price[/h3] (which is doubtful they would ever do)

Or pirate it. I don't feel bad for EA losing some pennies based on the disgusting monetization model they have created.
